items.title: France's Macron Meets Canada's Carney at Davos
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron met Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Tuesday. Macron has been battling an eye condition that he has said is “completely harmless” but has made his right eye look red and puffy. He first sported sunglasses last week when…

items.title: France's Macron calls on EU to be ready to activate its 'trade bazooka'
items.standfirst: French president Emmanuel Macron spoke out against Donald Trump's latest tariff threat, describing his approach to trade deals as bullying and an attempt to weaken and subordinate Europe. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French leader called on the EU to be ready to activate its powerful anti-coercion mechanism, colloquially called the "trade bazooka".
items.content: French president Emmanuel Macron spoke out against Donald Trump's latest tariff threat, describing his approach to trade deals as bullying and an attempt to weaken and subordinate Europe. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French leader called on the EU to be ready to activate its powerful anti-coercion mechanism, colloquially called the "trade bazooka".

items.title: After Trump salvo, Macron says: we don't give in to bullies
items.standfirst: The President of France warned against US attempts to "subordinate Europe". Speaking in Davos, Switzerland, Emmanuel Macron blasted as "unacceptable" Trump's threats to impose tariffs of up to 25% on countries opposed to his Greenland takeover plans. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.
items.content: The President of France warned against US attempts to "subordinate Europe". Speaking in Davos, Switzerland, Emmanuel Macron blasted as "unacceptable" Trump's threats to impose tariffs of up to 25% on countries opposed to his Greenland takeover plans. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.standfirst: Macron said Europe will not be “intimidated” by US President Donald Trump’s threat of tariffs over Greenland.
items.content: Macron said Europe will not be “intimidated” by US President Donald Trump’s threat of tariffs over Greenland.

items.title: How can Europe respond to Trump’s Greenland tariffs threat?
items.standfirst: The United States's claim to the Danish territory has sparked fears of a trade war.
items.content: The United States's claim to the Danish territory has sparked fears of a trade war.

items.title: Europe condemns Trump’s ‘new colonialism’ as Greenland crisis grows
items.standfirst: US president says there is ‘no going back’ on goal of controlling Arctic territory as Emmanuel Macron leads European resistanceEuropean leaders have lined up to condemn Donald Trump’s “new colonialism” and warn that the continent was facing a crossroads as the US president said there was no going back on his goal of controlling Greenland.After weeks of aggressive threats by Trump to seize the vast Arctic island, which is a largely autonomous part of Denmark, Emmanuel Macron, the French president, said on Tuesday he preferred “respect to bullies” and the “rule of law to brutality”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says there is ‘no going back’ on goal of controlling Arctic territory as Emmanuel Macron leads European resistanceEuropean leaders have lined up to condemn Donald Trump’s “new colonialism” and warn that the continent was facing a crossroads as the US president said there was no going back on his goal of controlling Greenland.After weeks of aggressive threats by Trump to seize the vast Arctic island, which is a largely autonomous part of Denmark, Emmanuel Macron, the French president, said on Tuesday he preferred “respect to bullies” and the “rule of law to brutality”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Spain's commuter train hits collapsed wall, killing at least 1 person
clusters.neutral_headline: Commuter train near Barcelona hits collapsed wall injuring several people

items.title: Spain's commuter train hits collapsed wall, killing at least 1 person
items.standfirst: A commuter train hit a collapsed retaining wall near Barcelona on Tuesday, killing one person and injuring at least 15 people, according to officials.
items.content: A commuter train hit a collapsed retaining wall near Barcelona on Tuesday, killing one person and injuring at least 15 people, according to officials.

items.title: Driver killed and several injured after train derails near Barcelona, local media report
items.standfirst: At least 14 people are known to have been injured after a commuter train crashed between Gelida and Sant Sadurní.
items.content: At least 14 people are known to have been injured after a commuter train crashed between Gelida and Sant Sadurní.

items.title: Commuter train near Barcelona hits collapsed wall injuring several people
items.standfirst: Incident in Spain took place days after collision between two high-speed trains in Andalucía that killed at least 42A commuter train has hit a collapsed retaining wall near Barcelona, injuring several people, officials in the Catalonia region of north-eastern Spain have said.The incident on Tuesday came just two days after the collision of two high-speed trains in Andalucía, in the south of the country, which left at least 42 people dead and dozens injured. Continue reading...
items.content: Incident in Spain took place days after collision between two high-speed trains in Andalucía that killed at least 42A commuter train has hit a collapsed retaining wall near Barcelona, injuring several people, officials in the Catalonia region of north-eastern Spain have said.The incident on Tuesday came just two days after the collision of two high-speed trains in Andalucía, in the south of the country, which left at least 42 people dead and dozens injured. Continue reading...

items.content: At least 40 people have been killed and 170 others injured after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain on Sunday.

items.title: At least 40 dead, dozens injured after high-speed trains collide in Spain
items.standfirst: A high-speed train derailed in southern Spain on Sunday, jumping onto the track in the opposite direction and hitting an oncoming train in an accident that authorities estimate left more than 20 people dead and dozens injured.
items.content: A high-speed train derailed in southern Spain on Sunday, jumping onto the track in the opposite direction and hitting an oncoming train in an accident that authorities estimate left more than 20 people dead and dozens injured.

The move amends the streaming giant's…

items.title: Netflix sweetens Warner Bros. bid with all-cash proposal as battle with Paramount intensifies
items.standfirst: Netflix has changed the terms of its Warner Bros. Discovery acquisition to an all-cash proposal, hoping the new structure will win over shareholders as a rival media company continues to push its own competing offer.
items.content: Netflix has changed the terms of its Warner Bros. Discovery acquisition to an all-cash proposal, hoping the new structure will win over shareholders as a rival media company continues to push its own competing offer.

Discovery’s studio and streaming business in all cash — in an effort to win over the Hollywood giant’s shareholders for its $72 billion merger and potentially thwart a hostile bid from Skydance-owned Paramount. items.title: Netflix sweetens Warner Bros bid with all-cash offer to block Paramount
items.standfirst: Streaming company says proposal speeds up completion and allows WBD investors to vote as soon as AprilNetflix has sweetened its $82.7bn (£61.5bn) offer for the studios and streaming businesses of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) by making it an all-cash deal, streamlining its potential completion in the face of a hostile bid from Paramount Skydance.The streaming company had originally secured the unanimous backing of the WBD board last month with a cash-and-shares proposal that valued the business at $27.75 a share. Continue reading...
items.content: Streaming company says proposal speeds up completion and allows WBD investors to vote as soon as AprilNetflix has sweetened its $82.7bn (£61.5bn) offer for the studios and streaming businesses of Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) by making it an all-cash deal, streamlining its potential completion in the face of a hostile bid from Paramount Skydance.The streaming company had originally secured the unanimous backing of the WBD board last month with a cash-and-shares proposal that valued the business at $27.75 a share. Continue reading...

items.title: Netflix’s Amended Offer Puts Pressure on Paramount | Bloomberg Tech 1/20/2026
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s amended, all-cash offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming business. Plus, as tech leaders sit down with Bloomberg from Davos, Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says Chinese AI firms are six months behind US frontier models. And, funding continues to pour into defense tech startups. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s amended, all-cash offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming business. Plus, as tech leaders sit down with Bloomberg from Davos, Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says Chinese AI firms are six months behind US frontier models. And, funding continues to pour into defense tech startups. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: This is Not Our Bill: Coinbase CEO Armstrong
items.standfirst: Coinbase's Brian Armstrong still sees a path for the US to pass comprehensive crypto legislation even after helping to derail a bill last week. He pulled support for the latest draft of digital asset market structure legislation in a Jan. 14 social media post. Within hours of Armstrong’s post, Senate Banking Chairman Tim Scott announced he would postpone a planned markup. Armstrong spoke today with Bloomberg’s Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Coinbase's Brian Armstrong still sees a path for the US to pass comprehensive crypto legislation even after helping to derail a bill last week. He pulled support for the latest draft of digital asset market structure legislation in a Jan. 14 social media post. Within hours of Armstrong’s post, Senate Banking Chairman Tim Scott announced he would postpone a planned markup. Armstrong spoke today with Bloomberg’s Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix switches its Warner Bros offer to all-cash deal to quell Paramount
items.standfirst: The switch in its offer comes as Paramount Skydance has campaigned that its bid is superior to Netflix's.
items.content: The switch in its offer comes as Paramount Skydance has campaigned that its bid is superior to Netflix's.

items.title: Tech Chiefs at Davos Highlight AI’s Power as a Geopolitical Tool
items.standfirst: Anthropic’s Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei compared artificial intelligence chips to nuclear weapons. Google DeepMind’s CEO said China’s technology is just months behind the US. Signal’s Meredith Whittaker called new adaptations of AI uniquely “perilous.”
items.content: Anthropic’s Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei compared artificial intelligence chips to nuclear weapons. Google DeepMind’s CEO said China’s technology is just months behind the US. Signal’s Meredith Whittaker called new adaptations of AI uniquely “perilous.”

items.title: DeepMind CEO Says Chinese AI Firms Are 6 Months Behind the West
items.standfirst: Google DeepMind Chief Executive Officer Demis Hassabis said Chinese artificial intelligence companies haven’t been able to innovate beyond the cutting edge of technology and remain about six months behind the frontier AI of the leading western labs.
items.content: Google DeepMind Chief Executive Officer Demis Hassabis said Chinese artificial intelligence companies haven’t been able to innovate beyond the cutting edge of technology and remain about six months behind the frontier AI of the leading western labs.

items.content: Streaming group is competing with Paramount over prized studio assets

items.title: Robotics Nearing Physical AI Breakthrough, Google DeepMind CEO Says
items.standfirst: Google DeepMind Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer Demis Hassabis sees robotics as being “on the cusp of a kind of break through moment in physical intelligence.” He speaks with Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos, Switzerland on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Google DeepMind Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer Demis Hassabis sees robotics as being “on the cusp of a kind of break through moment in physical intelligence.” He speaks with Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos, Switzerland on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Lumen Technologies CEO on Partnership With Palantir, AI
items.standfirst: Lumen Technologies President and CEO Kate Johnson discusses the partnership with Palantir, importing AI and the outlook for the company. She speaks on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Lumen Technologies President and CEO Kate Johnson discusses the partnership with Palantir, importing AI and the outlook for the company. She speaks on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Palantir CEO Says AI to Make Large-Scale Immigration Obsolete
items.standfirst: Artificial intelligence will displace so many jobs that it will eliminate the need for mass immigration, according to Palantir Technologies Inc. Chief Executive Officer Alex Karp.
items.content: Artificial intelligence will displace so many jobs that it will eliminate the need for mass immigration, according to Palantir Technologies Inc. Chief Executive Officer Alex Karp.

items.title: Netflix Amends Warner Bros. Bid to Make It All Cash
items.standfirst: Netflix reached an amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery’s studio and streaming business as it battles Paramount Skydance. Geetha Ranganathan has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix reached an amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery’s studio and streaming business as it battles Paramount Skydance. Geetha Ranganathan has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: AI Agents ‘Perilous’ to Secure Apps, Signal’s Whittaker Says
items.standfirst: Signal Foundation President Meredith Whittaker discussed the threats that artificial intelligence agents that autonomously carry out tasks pose to secure apps. “If you give a system like that root access permissions, it can be hijacked,” Whittaker said during a conversation with Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos, Switzerland on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Signal Foundation President Meredith Whittaker discussed the threats that artificial intelligence agents that autonomously carry out tasks pose to secure apps. “If you give a system like that root access permissions, it can be hijacked,” Whittaker said during a conversation with Emily Chang at Bloomberg House in Davos, Switzerland on Tuesday. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: AI Agents ‘Perilous’ for Secure Apps Such as Signal, Whittaker Says
items.standfirst: Artificial intelligence agents that autonomously carry out tasks pose a threat to secure apps such as Signal, according to Meredith Whittaker, president of the Signal Foundation.
items.content: Artificial intelligence agents that autonomously carry out tasks pose a threat to secure apps such as Signal, according to Meredith Whittaker, president of the Signal Foundation.

items.title: Signal's Whittaker on Privacy in the Age of Data and AI
items.standfirst: Meredith Whittaker, President, Signal Foundation, sits down with Bloomberg's Emily Chang to discuss the future of security, digital rights and the growing precarity of personal privacy in the age of AI at Bloomberg House in Davos on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Meredith Whittaker, President, Signal Foundation, sits down with Bloomberg's Emily Chang to discuss the future of security, digital rights and the growing precarity of personal privacy in the age of AI at Bloomberg House in Davos on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum. (Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.title: UK to hand Chagos Islands to Mauritius despite Trump’s taunts, No 10 says
clusters.neutral_headline: UK to hand Chagos Islands to Mauritius despite Trump’s taunts, No 10 says

items.title: UK to hand Chagos Islands to Mauritius despite Trump’s taunts, No 10 says
items.standfirst: PM’s spokesperson insists government’s position is unchanged and that the US still supports the dealThe UK will press ahead with plans to hand the Chagos Islands back to Mauritius despite Donald Trump calling it an “act of great stupidity” and suggesting it was among the reasons he wants to take over Greenland.The US president said ceding sovereignty of the British Indian Ocean Territory, which includes the Diego Garcia military base, was a sign of “total weakness” by the UK. Continue reading...
items.content: PM’s spokesperson insists government’s position is unchanged and that the US still supports the dealThe UK will press ahead with plans to hand the Chagos Islands back to Mauritius despite Donald Trump calling it an “act of great stupidity” and suggesting it was among the reasons he wants to take over Greenland.The US president said ceding sovereignty of the British Indian Ocean Territory, which includes the Diego Garcia military base, was a sign of “total weakness” by the UK. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says U.K. return of Chagos Islands to Mauritius is reason to acquire Greenland
items.standfirst: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the U.S.-U.K. Diego Garcia military base.
items.content: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the U.S.-U.K. Diego Garcia military base.(Image credit: U.S. Navy)

items.title: What is the UK's Chagos Islands deal and why has Trump criticised it?

items.content: Trump has criticised the deal under which the UK keeps control of the joint UK-US Diego Garcia military base.

items.title: Trump U-turns on U.K.-Chagos Islands deal, links it to bid for Greenland

items.content: Trump says the U.K. decision to hand a strategic island to Mauritius, which he previously supported, was stupid, and justification for his attempt to acquire Greenland.

items.title: As Trump brands decision 'act of great stupidity' - what is in the Chagos Islands deal?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has slammed the UK's decision to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, in a deal that includes a formal transfer of Diego Garcia, home to a key US military base.
items.content: Donald Trump has slammed the UK's decision to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, in a deal that includes a formal transfer of Diego Garcia, home to a key US military base.

items.title: ‘You’ll find out’: Trump refuses to say how far he would go to seize Greenland
items.standfirst: President also declines to offer any reassurances about his commitment to the stability of Nato allianceDonald Trump ratcheted up the uncertainty over how far he would be willing to go to acquire Greenland as he warned the Nato alliance on Tuesday that it was only as strong as the United States allowed it to be.“You’ll find out,” Trump said in a terse reply at a White House press briefing before moving to the next question. Continue reading...
items.content: President also declines to offer any reassurances about his commitment to the stability of Nato allianceDonald Trump ratcheted up the uncertainty over how far he would be willing to go to acquire Greenland as he warned the Nato alliance on Tuesday that it was only as strong as the United States allowed it to be.“You’ll find out,” Trump said in a terse reply at a White House press briefing before moving to the next question. items.title: U.S. seizes a seventh Venezuelan-linked oil tanker in Caribbean

items.content: The U.S. has seized seven Venezuelan-linked oil tankers since Dec. 10​, 2025.

items.title: US military says it seized another Venezuela-linked oil tanker
items.standfirst: Seizing of vessel in Caribbean Sea is seventh apprehension in Trump’s campaign to control Venezuela’s oil flowsThe US military said it seized another oil tanker with links to Venezuela on Tuesday, in the Caribbean Sea.The report marks the seventh such apprehension since the start of Donald Trump’s month-long campaign to control Venezuela’s oil flows. clusters.title: Six-year-old girl is only member of family to survive Spanish rail disaster
clusters.neutral_headline: Six-year-old girl is only member of family to survive Spanish rail disaster

items.title: Six-year-old girl is only member of family to survive Spanish rail disaster
items.standfirst: Child was on way home from a musical with parents, brother and cousin when trains collided, killing 42 peopleA six-year-old girl who had travelled to Madrid to see a musical was the only member of her family to survive Sunday’s rail disaster in southern Spain, which killed 42 people, among them her parents, her brother and her cousin.The girl, who has not been named, was found walking along the tracks after two trains collided near the town of Adamuz in the Córdoba province of Andalucía. She had emerged from the accident with only a minor head wound. Continue reading...
items.content: Child was on way home from a musical with parents, brother and cousin when trains collided, killing 42 peopleA six-year-old girl who had travelled to Madrid to see a musical was the only member of her family to survive Sunday’s rail disaster in southern Spain, which killed 42 people, among them her parents, her brother and her cousin.The girl, who has not been named, was found walking along the tracks after two trains collided near the town of Adamuz in the Córdoba province of Andalucía. She had emerged from the accident with only a minor head wound. Continue reading...

items.title: 'The miracle': A 6-year-old walked away from the train wreck that killed her family
items.standfirst: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandparents after receiving three stitches in her head.
items.content: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandparents after receiving three stitches in her head.(Image credit: Manu Fernandez)

items.title: UK approves new Chinese ‘mega embassy’ in London despite security concerns
items.standfirst: The UK goverenment on Tuesday approved a 20,000-square-metre plot of land, known as Royal Mint Court, for China's new embassy in London. The decision has stoked heated controversy, mostly over national security concerns and the signal it could send, that Britain bows to economic pressure from Beijing.
items.content: The UK goverenment on Tuesday approved a 20,000-square-metre plot of land, known as Royal Mint Court, for China's new embassy in London. The decision has stoked heated controversy, mostly over national security concerns and the signal it could send, that Britain bows to economic pressure from Beijing.

items.title: UK approves Chinese ‘mega embassy’ in London after reassurances from spy chiefs
items.standfirst: Critics expected to mount legal challenge to plans for vast complex at Royal Mint Court amid security concernsThe communities secretary, Steve Reed, has given permission for China to build a vast new embassy near the Tower of London after spy chiefs told him that the risks to UK national security could be controlled and dealt with.The decision paves the way for Keir Starmer to visit Beijing in the coming weeks – though local residents plan to legally challenge the decision, potentially delaying the development by months or years. Continue reading...
items.content: Critics expected to mount legal challenge to plans for vast complex at Royal Mint Court amid security concernsThe communities secretary, Steve Reed, has given permission for China to build a vast new embassy near the Tower of London after spy chiefs told him that the risks to UK national security could be controlled and dealt with.The decision paves the way for Keir Starmer to visit Beijing in the coming weeks – though local residents plan to legally challenge the decision, potentially delaying the development by months or years. Continue reading...

items.title: Colombia sentences ex-paramilitary leader Mancuso to 40 years in jail
items.standfirst: Salvatore Mancuso's group committed more than 100 crimes, many targeting an indigenous group, the tribunal ruled.
items.content: Salvatore Mancuso's group committed more than 100 crimes, many targeting an indigenous group, the tribunal ruled.

items.title: Colombian ex-paramilitary leader jailed for crimes against Indigenous groups
items.standfirst: Salvatore Mancuso given 40-year sentence, which could be reduced after truth and reparation activitiesA Colombian court has sentenced a former paramilitary leader to 40 years in prison for crimes committed against Indigenous communities in the province of La Guajira, including homicides, forced disappearances and the displacement of people from 2002 to 2006.The special tribunal that hears cases from the country’s armed conflict said in its ruling that Salvatore Mancuso was responsible for 117 crimes committed by fighters under his command in La Guajira. However, it added that Mancuso’s time in prison could be reduced to eight years, if he collaborated with truth and reparation activities that benefited victims of his former paramilitary group. Continue reading...
items.content: Salvatore Mancuso given 40-year sentence, which could be reduced after truth and reparation activitiesA Colombian court has sentenced a former paramilitary leader to 40 years in prison for crimes committed against Indigenous communities in the province of La Guajira, including homicides, forced disappearances and the displacement of people from 2002 to 2006.The special tribunal that hears cases from the country’s armed conflict said in its ruling that Salvatore Mancuso was responsible for 117 crimes committed by fighters under his command in La Guajira. However, it added that Mancuso’s time in prison could be reduced to eight years, if he collaborated with truth and reparation activities that benefited victims of his former paramilitary group. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Israel bulldozes Unrwa headquarters in East Jerusalem

items.title: Israel bulldozes Unrwa headquarters in East Jerusalem
items.standfirst: Palestinian refugee agency compound is demolished, while teargas is fired at UN vocational school in West BankIsraeli crews have started bulldozing the Jerusalem headquarters of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees in Jerusalem and fired teargas at a UN vocational school in Qalandia, in the West Bank.Israel accuses the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (Unwra) of collaborating with Hamas – a charge the agency denies – and last year banned it from operating on its territory. The demolition marks Israel’s latest step against Unrwa, which provides aid to millions of Palestinian refugees. Continue reading...
items.content: Palestinian refugee agency compound is demolished, while teargas is fired at UN vocational school in West BankIsraeli crews have started bulldozing the Jerusalem headquarters of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees in Jerusalem and fired teargas at a UN vocational school in Qalandia, in the West Bank.Israel accuses the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (Unwra) of collaborating with Hamas – a charge the agency denies – and last year banned it from operating on its territory. The demolition marks Israel’s latest step against Unrwa, which provides aid to millions of Palestinian refugees. Continue reading...

items.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un dismisses vice premier, comparing him to 'a goat yoked to pull an ox cart'
items.standfirst: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has dismissed a vice premier over a factory modernisation project in a rare public rebuke ahead of a ruling party congress, state media has reported.
items.content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has dismissed a vice premier over a factory modernisation project in a rare public rebuke ahead of a ruling party congress, state media has reported.

items.title: Kim Jong-un fires vice-premier and likens him to ‘a goat yoked to an ox cart’
items.standfirst: North Korean leader reportedly blames Yang Sung-ho for ‘confusion’ at factory project as major congress loomsThe North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, has dismissed a vice-premier over troubles in a factory modernisation project, in an apparent move to tighten discipline among officials and push them to deliver greater results before a major political conference.The upcoming ruling Workers’ party congress, the first of its kind in five years, is one of North Korea’s biggest propaganda spectacles and is intended to review past projects, establish new political and economic priorities and reshuffle officials. Continue reading...

Continue reading...
